The admin sent secure messages signed using RSA with a low exponent. Can you forge a valid signature on 0x4811d24c6969020e5c76a3d164cc352ab43938ead5f5e156a653b5c09750d31cea90a2b55e3e874fe4c6114bfa531d33bb28d05b5bd1fe5372c72c7e83d45cc1 to impersonate the admin?

Public Key (n, e): (11111885679496353252459981865831441185289994676674978213373208088159880936421927678526026038011257155968432332089156577743359519776190394858784686567619891, 3)

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{iigtzqmx}
ciphertext: 0x4811d24c6969020e5c76a3d164cc352ab43938ead5f5e156a653b5c09750d31cea90a2b55e3e874fe4c6114bfa531d33bb28d05b5bd1fe5372c72c7e83d45cc1
cipher: RSA Low-Exponent Signature
hint: What happens when you cube small numbers? Remember e=3!
necessary_info: Public Key (n, e): (11111885679496353252459981865831441185289994676674978213373208088159880936421927678526026038011257155968432332089156577743359519776190394858784686567619891, 3)
subtype: rsa_sign_with_low_public_exponent
archetype: signature_schemes
